issue_tech: Ignition/Distributor Engine Speed Input Circuit Malfunction
issue_plain: Your engine’s computer isn’t getting a signal from the crankshaft or distributor.
consequences: If ignored, your engine may stall unexpectedly or fail to start at all.
diy: Challenging but possible with basic tools and a replacement sensor.
impact: Minimal emissions increase, but repeated misfires can damage the catalytic converter.
prevention: Regular sensor inspections and securing wiring harnesses.

issue_plain: Your catalytic converter isn’t cleaning the exhaust as it should.
consequences: Failed emissions test, increased pollution, potential engine damage.
diy: Not recommended — requires cutting exhaust piping and welding.
impact: Major contributor to emissions if not fixed.
prevention: Avoid driving with misfires or bad sensors that lead to premature failure.
